description: Let P = all numbers that can be obtained by permuting the digits of n and possibly adding or omitting zeros; a(n) = |n-q| where q in P is the closest number to n different different from n (a(n)=0 if no such q exists).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 18 2000
extensions: More terms from Asher Natan Auel (auela(AT)reed.edu), May 12, 2000
